scheme_data.schemeName: Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "4gyLHI0BvvukECfi8-r2", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Chhattisgarh"], "schemeShortTitle": "AKSMSY", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Business & Entrepreneurship", "Women and Child"], "schemeName": "Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "aksmsy", "briefDescription": "Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana\u00a0started by the Government of Chhattisgarh in 2012. \n", "age": {"female": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}}, "tags": ["Sewing Machine", "Empowerment", "Business"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana. It is also known as AKSMSY. The Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana (Unorganized Workers Sewing Machine Assistance Scheme) is a government scheme in Chhattisgarh State that provides sewing machines. The objective of this scheme is to promote unorganized workers in their businesses and make them self-reliant. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Chhattisgarh. Additionally, the nodal department is Labour Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under the scheme, sewing machines will be supplied every year to the registered unorganized women workers of the state.

Eligibility criteria include: Women who work in construction and are registered with the labor board/department.
Women between the ages of 18 and 50 who sew, embroider, or weave (tailor) clothes, are employed by an employer or have their own business, and earn a living for themselves and their families, in any district of the state.
Women who have not received a sewing machine or an amount equal to the value of a sewing machine under any other scheme run by the state government.
Women who have not received benefits under the Chief Minister Cycle Assistance Scheme run by the labor board/department. The application process is as follows: Application Process
> StepApplicant have to visit the official labour website of Chhattisgarh State.

> StepClick on apply now under the Unorganized worder board option.

> StepNow applicant have to provide the below detail.



   District,
   Name of the Beneficiary.
   Father's / Husband's name.
   Preregistration no. 
   New registration no.
   And click on check the details


> StepNow select the scheme name here. 

> StepFill out the online form. 

> StepUpload required documents.



   Labor registration card.
   Age certificate.
   Bank passbook photocopy.
   Income certificate.


> StepClick on submit.

> StepNote the application number.



Trace the Application Status
> StepApplicant have to visit the official labour website of Chhattisgarh State.

> StepClick on "Check the application status" under the Unorganized worder board option.

> StepSelect the scheme name.

> StepEnter the application number. 

> StepClick on search. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://cglabour.nic.in/ShramAyuktNew/mukhyamantree%20asangathit%20karmakaar%20silaee%20masheen%20sahayata%20yojana.pdf Official Website: https://cglabour.nic.in/ShramAyuktHome.aspx Tags associated with the scheme include: Business, Empowerment, Sewing Machine.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana.
It is also known as AKSMSY.
The Asangathit Karmakaar Silai Machine Sahayata Yojana (Unorganized Workers Sewing Machine Assistance Scheme) is a government scheme in Chhattisgarh State that provides sewing machines.
The objective of this scheme is to promote unorganized workers in their businesses and make them self-reliant.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Chhattisgarh.
Additionally, the nodal department is Labour Department.
The scheme provides the following benefits: Under the scheme, sewing machines will be supplied every year to the registered unorganized women workers of the state.
Eligibility criteria include: Women who work in construction and are registered with the labor board/department.

Women between the ages of 18 and 50 who sew, embroider, or weave (tailor) clothes, are employed by an employer or have their own business, and earn a living for themselves and their families, in any district of the state.
Women who have not received a sewing machine or an amount equal to the value of a sewing machine under any other scheme run by the state government.
Women who have not received benefits under the Chief Minister Cycle Assistance Scheme run by the labor board/department.
The application process is as follows: Application Process > StepApplicant have to visit the official labour website of Chhattisgarh State.
> StepClick on apply now under the Unorganized worder board option.
> StepNow applicant have to provide the below detail.
And click on check the details > StepNow select the scheme name here.
Trace the Application Status > StepApplicant have to visit the official labour website of Chhattisgarh State.
> StepClick on "Check the application status" under the Unorganized worder board option.
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://cglabour.
aspx Tags associated with the scheme include: Business, Empowerment, Sewing Machine.
